metadata.description: Input RDP properties to add or remove RDP functionality on the AVD host pool. Settings reference: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-server/remote/remote-desktop-services/clients/rdp-files?context=/azure/virtual-desktop/context/context
Enable BitLocker encrytion on the AVD session hosts and management VM if applicable.
The storage SKU for the AVD session host disks.  Production deployments should use Premium_LRS.
The password of the privileged account to domain join the AVD session hosts to your domain
The UPN of the privileged account to domain join the AVD session hosts to your domain. This should be an account the resides within the domain you are joining.
The name of the domain that provides ADDS to the AVD session hosts and is synchronized with Azure AD
The service providing domain services for Azure Virtual Desktop.  This is needed to determine the proper solution to domain join the Azure Storage Account.
Enable drain mode on sessions hosts during deployment to prevent users from accessing the session hosts.

Choose whether the session host uses an ephemeral disk for the operating system.  Be sure to select a VM SKU that offers a temporary disk that meets your image requirements. Reference: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/virtual-machines/ephemeral-os-disks
Enable FSLogix to manage user profiles for the AVD session hosts.
These options specify the host pool type and depending on the type provides the load balancing options and assignment types.
Offer for the virtual machine image
Publisher for the virtual machine image
SKU for the virtual machine image
Version for the virtual machine image
The Active Directory computer object Kerberos encryption type for the Azure Storage Account.
The retention for the Log Analytics Workspace to setup the AVD Monitoring solution
The SKU for the Log Analytics Workspace to setup the AVD Monitoring solution
The maximum number of sessions per AVD session host.
Sets whether this is the first deployment of this solution or is a follow up deployment to add new or additional AVD session hosts.
The distinguished name for the target Organization Unit in Active Directory Domain Services.
Enables the RDP Short Path feature: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/virtual-desktop/shortpath

Enable backups to an Azure Recovery Services vault.  For a pooled host pool this will enable backups on the Azure file share.  For a personal host pool this will enable backups on the AVD sessions hosts.

Use letters and numbers only.  This suffix is used in conjunction with the resource type prefixes to name most of the Azure resources in this solution.  The only exception is the Storage Account since the value must globally unique and has stricter character requirements.
Time when session hosts will scale up and continue to stay on to support peak demand; Format 24 hours e.g. 9:00 for 9am
Time when session hosts will scale down and stay off to support low demand; Format 24 hours e.g. 17:00 for 5pm
The number of seconds to wait before automatically signing out users. If set to 0 any session host that has user sessions will be left untouched

The minimum number of session host VMs to keep running during off-peak hours. The scaling tool will not work if all virtual machines are turned off and the Start VM On Connect solution is not enabled.
The maximum number of sessions per CPU that will be used as a threshold to determine when new session host VMs need to be started during peak hours
Time zone off set for host pool location; Format 24 hours e.g. -4:00 for Eastern Daylight Time

Determines whether the Screen Capture Protection feature is enabled.  As of 9/17/21 this is only supported in Azure Cloud. https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/virtual-desktop/screen-capture-protection
The Object ID for the Security Principal to assign to the AVD Application Group.  This Security Principal will be assigned the Desktop Virtualization User role on the Application Group.

The name for the Security Principal to assign NTFS permissions on the Azure File Share to support FSLogix.  Any value can be input in this field if performing a deployment update or choosing a personal host pool.
The number of session hosts to deploy in the host pool
The session host number to begin with for the deployment. This is important when adding virtual machines to ensure the names do not conflict.
Determines whether the Start VM On Connect feature is enabled. https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/virtual-desktop/start-virtual-machine-connect

The SKU for the Azure storage account containing the AVD user profile data.  The selected SKU should provide sufficient IOPS for all of your users. https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/architecture/example-scenario/wvd/windows-virtual-desktop-fslogix#performance-requirements
The subnet for the AVD session hosts.
Key / value pairs of metadata for the Azure resources.
The value determines whether the hostpool should receive early AVD updates for testing.
Virtual network for the AVD sessions hosts
Virtual network resource group for the AVD sessions hosts
Local administrator password for the AVD session hosts
The VM SKU for the AVD session hosts.
The Local Administrator Username for the Session Hosts

The Object ID for the Windows Virtual Desktop Enterprise Application in Azure AD.  The Object ID can found by selecting Microsoft Applications using the Application type filter in the Enterprise Applications blade of Azure AD.
